name: Crowne Plaza Hotel Manchester City Centre

reviews.text: THis hotel has so much going for it I find my experience slightly dissapointing. On arrival i was allocated a room on the 4 floor. It was clean and tidy but it was clear the room had been adapted for disabled guests, now as someone who doesn't on principle park in a disabled bay at a supermarket or railway station i felt uncomfortable using a disabled room - more of a fraud. I wasn't asked if this was an acceptable room and unless all other rooms are fitted out this way - I think I should have been asked.
reviews.title: Felt like I had parked in a disabled spot

reviews.text: Secondly in the morining after showering - and obviously after every one else in the other rooms had showered the drains began to smell! Clearly there is a problem with the traps but regardless of the reason the bathroom and eventually the room were overcome by this smell.
reviews.title: superior city centre hotel

reviews.text: Overall what could have been a very positive stay left me slightly jaded.
reviews.title: You must try this hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall this was very disappointing.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel in perfect location.
Great location, needs some spice
reviews.text: the rooms in this hotel are fab. large comfortable double bed and plenty of room but best of all...the bathroom with large bath and separate walk-in shower which was almost too powerful. have stayed in the Hilton in Manchester and this hotel is at least as good. NCP parking just across the road. Arndale Centre close by and The Printworks has loads of eateries. If you love curry though I recommened a taxi or 30 minute walk to fantastic Akbar's on Liverpool Rd. It is brilliant.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked the CP for a Saturday show at the Arena. It's in a great location 10 minutes walk (Max) from the MEN.
reviews.title: Modern hotel in handy location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On arrival at the hotel we had booked a club room on the 8th floor so took advantage of the valet parking (£15) and went to check in. It was speedy, efficient and friendly. We were given a couple of tokens for a beer each plus others we couldn't make use of.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel but with a tiny tiny problem....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 5 minutes later and we were in the room. It was a good size with full floor to ceiling windows giving a fantastic view out over the Manchester skyline. Everything worked and looked new.
reviews.title: A Great Hotel in the city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Being in a club room we had access to the club lounge where a reasonable continental breakfast is available and drinks and snacks also from 6pm to 8pm. Unfortunately we couldn't take advatage of this going out for a meal before the show.
reviews.title: A good base for the city, especially the MEN

reviews.text: That night we found the bed to be extremely comfortable but, although there were 5 pillows on the bed they were all the same being reasonably firm - too firm for us. We didn't sleep too well and I was aware of the noise from the lift motor room. Street noise was well damped.
reviews.title: Very nice...similar to the Edwardian but better price!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent two nights at the Crowne Plaza in Manchester in a room with Club lounge access.
reviews.title: Funky Hotel with Cheerful Staff

reviews.text: We could not fault the hotel. It really was a great place to stay. The staff are cheerful and helpful (except for one grumpy bar staffer, but he will be the exception that proves the rule!) and willing to stop and have a chat.
reviews.title: Everything is top notch

reviews.text: The rooms are modern and the black, red and white decore may not be to everyone's taste. However, the king sized bed (in the executive rooms) and modern bathroom are great. The room has everything you would expect from a new hotel with a large flat-screen tv and free wi-fi.
reviews.title: Simply the best!

reviews.text: I would recommend upgrading your room to access the club lounge where there are free drinks at any time (and free alcoholic drinks and canapes between certain hours) and a quiet place to have a continental breakfast. If you'd prefer a hot breakfast, the cafe next door has reasonable and cheap food as mentioned by many other reviewers. There's also a convenience store right next door. Also, as mentioned by other, parking is in a nearby NCP carpark - however, there's a bay in front of the hotel where you can stop and unload your baggage from the car.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is located in the up-and-coming Northern Quarter. Shops and cafes surrounding the hotel are a mix of trendy and eclectic. The streets tend to go: a trendy shop, followed by a boarded up shop, followed by a trendy cafe, followed by a delrelict building! But it's all interesting and the Arts and Crafts centre is worth a visit. There's a chinese restaurant around the corner that's also modern with good value food.
reviews.title: excellent hotel for city centre stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband arranged a trip to manchester to celebrate/comiseraste me turning 30. We opted to stay at the Crowne Plaza after enjoying a 1 night stay in a club room in April and finding that is m ore than a match for and better situated than the HIlton, which we usually stay in.
reviews.title: Great way to comiserate being 30!

reviews.text: We got a great deal costing £126.50 per night in a club room, which also give you access tot he club lounge and the price also included breakfast. My husnband had arranged for champagne and chocolates on arrival and the hotel kindly upgraded us to a suite for no extra cost. He said the communication between him and the hotle was great as he was arranging these little extras.
reviews.title: Deserves the high ranking - a fantastic new Crowne Plaza!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check in was super quick and we were soon in our suite, which was modern and quirky (although slightly smaller than I had imagined) The champagne arrived quickly and as they had run out of the bottle my husband requested, we were upgraded to a better bottle free of charge. I also recieved a card from the hotel, which was a very nice touch.
reviews.title: As good as the reviews

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In the club lounge we took advantage of the free drinks and canapes, although there were not spirits available as it claims on the website, but again, we simply asked and we were told these were only available on weekdays (I thought friday was a weekday??) but we were given a spirit of our choice.
reviews.title: High standard, low price.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was self service and very nice and all the staff were very efficient, with plates being cleared in super quick time.
reviews.title: A good choice!

description: The Crowne Plaza Manchester City Centre is the hottest new hotel to land on the city in 2008. It is perfectly situated in the heart of Manchester in the trendy Northern Quarter, Victoria and Piccadilly Stations and Shudehill Tram and Bus Interchange are all within a short walking distance of this stunning new city centre hotel. The Crowne Plaza Manchester City Centre is ideally located within easy access to the MEN Arena, Manchester Central, the Printworks, Manchester Arndale Shopping Centre, Urbis, Manchester City and Manchester United football grounds. The Crowne Plaza Manchester City Centre has 228 luxurious bedrooms with one or two queen or king sized beds including Club Rooms, Junior and Presidential Suites, and a club floor with enhanced views and exclusive access to the top floor club lounge. The stylish rooms have superb contemporary bathrooms boasting separate bath and shower, LCD televisions and complimentary internet access. All guests have complimentary access to the gym which has a range of cardio-vascular equipment open 24 hours a day. The Glasshouse Bar and Restaurant is an ideal place to relax and unwind with a specialty cocktail or have dinner with colleagues or friends. The Crowne Plaza Manchester City Centre also offers nine modern and state-of-the art meeting rooms with a maximum capacity for up to 200 delegates with complimentary wireless internet access. Located right in the heart of Manchester on the edge of the captivating nightlife and excellent entertainment area including the trendy Northern Quarter, the hotel provides you with the gateway to what the city has to offer. With state of the art conference facilities and 228 individual bedroom experiences, every care has been taken to combine the edgy modern design of the building with contemporary luxury facilities.
